title: Orcish arrow
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Orcish_arrow/zh-CN "Orcish arrow/zh-CN")

| ) [![Orcish arrow.png](/images/a/a4/Orcish_arrow.png)](/wiki/File:Orcish_arrow.png) |                                                        |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------ |
| Name                                                                                | orcish arrow                                           |
| Appearance                                                                          | crude arrow                                            |
| Damage vs. small                                                                    | 1d5                                                    |
| Damage vs. large                                                                    | 1d6                                                    |
| To-hit bonus                                                                        | +0                                                     |
| Weapon skill                                                                        | [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow")                                 |
| Size                                                                                | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")            |
| Base price                                                                          | 2 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                                              | [1](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material                                                                            | [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")                              |

An **orcish arrow** is a type of [projectile](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **crude arrow** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

Orcish arrows are made for use with a [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow"), and gain +1 [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") when fired by an [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)") (including an [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") character) from an [orcish bow](/wiki/Orcish_bow "Orcish bow").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Orcish [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") start each game with +0 and +2 stacks of orcish arrows in place of the role's standard [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

[Uruk-hai](/wiki/Uruk-hai "Uruk-hai") have a 1⁄3 chance of being generated with an orcish bow and 3–14 [poisoned](/wiki/Poisoned "Poisoned") orcish arrows;[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) [orc-captains](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain") have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with Uruk-hai weapons, giving them an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating with an orcish bow and arrows.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Strategy

Orcish arrows are one of many poisonous threats in the early stages of the game, and one of the primary reasons that groups of Uruk-hai (and groups of [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)") in general) are best dealt with via crowd control strategies such as funneling them into hallways: a character that has not yet obtained [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") may have their game [unceremoniously ended](/wiki/YASD "YASD") by a distantly shot poisoned arrow. This also makes [Orcish Town](/wiki/Orcish_Town "Orcish Town") especially perilous to break into, since the level and others within the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") will be full of Uruk-hai amd orc captains.

In theory, characters may want a supply of poisoned projectiles to use against monsters, which can offset their otherwise-lower damage compared to other arrows - in practice, only orcish Rangers and other orcish bow-users will be able to get the most out of them: a character will want poison resistance to best deal with the projectiles in the first place, and many roles with early poison resistance are not particularly bow-proficient.

Non-orcish bow users may still consider them as a substitute for their primary arrow stack, at least until they can find [enchant weapon](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon") scrolls and a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone") or other [luck item](/wiki/Luck_item "Luck item") to minimize projectile mulching. Other characters can still pick up any orcish arrows left behind to prevent other monsters from becoming a threat with them until they gain poison resistance.

## History

The orcish arrow is introduced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") orcish arrows will produce standard arrows.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), orcish arrows deal 1d5 damage to small monsters and 1d8 damage to large monsters, with a -1 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") penalty.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [goblin outriders](/wiki/Goblin_outrider "Goblin outrider") have the same chance of generating with an orcish bow and arrows as Uruk-hai. [Watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") and [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") that are [orcish](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with orcish bows and arrows, and orcish [sergeants](/wiki/Sergeant "Sergeant") generated in stronghold areas may also generate with orcish arrows. [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa") is generated with an orcish bow and highly-enchanted orcish arrows that may be erodeproof.

The [ice trolls](/wiki/Ice_troll "Ice troll") stationed in each of the watch towers on the last level of the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm") are each generated with an orcish bow and 100 orcish arrows, both uncursed. The structure containing the [portal](/wiki/Portal "Portal") to the [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower_\(EvilHack\) "Wizard's Tower (EvilHack)") and the first floor of the branch are both guarded by a quartet of [mariliths](/wiki/Marilith "Marilith") that each generate with an orcish bow and 100 orcish arrows, both uncursed.

Orcish Rangers that [invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") [The Longbow of Diana](/wiki/The_Longbow_of_Diana "The Longbow of Diana") will generate orcish arrows instead of standard ones.

Orcish arrows can be used at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") to create a couple of items:

- 2 orcish arrows can be combined with a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") to create an [orcish dagger](/wiki/Orcish_dagger "Orcish dagger").
- 2 orcish arrows can be combined with an orcish dagger to create an [orcish spear](/wiki/Orcish_spear "Orcish spear").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), upgrading orcish arrows will produce standard arrows, and upgrading [elven arrows](/wiki/Elven_arrow "Elven arrow") will produce orcish arrows.

In addition to EvilHack forge recipes, 2 [darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart") can be combined with 2 orcish arrows to create a knife.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 172](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dothrow.c#L172): *multishot bonus*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 216](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L216)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 412](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L412)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 157](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L157)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 402](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L402): *switch for orc-captains*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Orcish arrow

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
)
Name orcish arrow
Appearance crude arrow
Damage vs. small 1d5
Damage vs. large 1d6
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill bow
Size one-handed
Base price 2 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 1
Material iron

An orcish arrow is a type of projectile that appears in NetHack. It is made of iron, and appears as a crude arrow when unidentified.

Orcish arrows are made for use with a bow, and gain +1 multishot when fired by an orc (including an orcish character) from an orcish bow.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 EvilHack
    • 4.4 Hack'EM
  • 5 References

Generation

Orcish Rangers start each game with +0 and +2 stacks of orcish arrows in place of the role's standard arrows.[2]

Uruk-hai have a 1⁄3 chance of being generated with an orcish bow and 3–14 poisoned orcish arrows;[3][4] orc-captains have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with Uruk-hai weapons, giving them an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating with an orcish bow and arrows.[5]

Strategy

Orcish arrows are one of many poisonous threats in the early stages of the game, and one of the primary reasons that groups of Uruk-hai (and groups of orcs in general) are best dealt with via crowd control strategies such as funneling them into hallways: a character that has not yet obtained poison resistance may have their game unceremoniously ended by a distantly shot poisoned arrow. This also makes Orcish Town especially perilous to break into, since the level and others within the Gnomish Mines will be full of Uruk-hai amd orc captains.

In theory, characters may want a supply of poisoned projectiles to use against monsters, which can offset their otherwise-lower damage compared to other arrows - in practice, only orcish Rangers and other orcish bow-users will be able to get the most out of them: a character will want poison resistance to best deal with the projectiles in the first place, and many roles with early poison resistance are not particularly bow-proficient.

Non-orcish bow users may still consider them as a substitute for their primary arrow stack, at least until they can find enchant weapon scrolls and a luckstone or other luck item to minimize projectile mulching. Other characters can still pick up any orcish arrows left behind to prevent other monsters from becoming a threat with them until they gain poison resistance.

History

The orcish arrow is introduced in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, upgrading orcish arrows will produce standard arrows.

dNetHack

In dNetHack and notdNetHack, orcish arrows deal 1d5 damage to small monsters and 1d8 damage to large monsters, with a -1 to-hit penalty.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, goblin outriders have the same chance of generating with an orcish bow and arrows as Uruk-hai. Watchmen and soldiers that are orcish have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with orcish bows and arrows, and orcish sergeants generated in stronghold areas may also generate with orcish arrows. Medusa is generated with an orcish bow and highly-enchanted orcish arrows that may be erodeproof.

The ice trolls stationed in each of the watch towers on the last level of the Ice Queen's Realm are each generated with an orcish bow and 100 orcish arrows, both uncursed. The structure containing the portal to the Wizard's Tower and the first floor of the branch are both guarded by a quartet of mariliths that each generate with an orcish bow and 100 orcish arrows, both uncursed.

Orcish Rangers that invoke The Longbow of Diana will generate orcish arrows instead of standard ones.

Orcish arrows can be used at a forge to create a couple of items:

  • 2 orcish arrows can be combined with a knife to create an orcish dagger.
  • 2 orcish arrows can be combined with an orcish dagger to create an orcish spear.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, upgrading orcish arrows will produce standard arrows, and upgrading elven arrows will produce orcish arrows.

In addition to EvilHack forge recipes, 2 darts can be combined with 2 orcish arrows to create a knife.

References

  1. ↑ src/dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 172: multishot bonus
  2. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 216
  3. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 412
  4. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 157
  5. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 402: switch for orc-captains

An '''orcish arrow''' is a type of [[projectile]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is made of [[iron]], and appears as a '''crude arrow''' when [[Identification|unidentified]].

Orcish arrows are made for use with a [[bow]], and gain +1 [[multishot]] when fired by an [[Orc (monster attribute)|orc]] (including an [[Orc (starting race)|orcish]] character) from an [[orcish bow]].{{refsrc|src/dothrow.c|172|nethack=3.6.7|comment=multishot bonus}}

==Generation==
Orcish [[Ranger]]s start each game with +0 and +2 stacks of orcish arrows in place of the role's standard [[arrow]]s.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|216|nethack=3.6.7}}

[[Uruk-hai]] have a {{frac|3}} chance of being generated with an orcish bow and {{rn1|12|3}} [[poisoned]] orcish arrows;{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|412|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|157|nethack=3.6.7}} [[orc-captain]]s have a {{frac|2}} chance of being generated with Uruk-hai weapons, giving them an effective {{frac|6}} chance of generating with an orcish bow and arrows.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|402|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=switch for orc-captains}}

==Strategy==
Orcish arrows are one of many poisonous threats in the early stages of the game, and one of the primary reasons that groups of Uruk-hai (and groups of [[Orc (monster class)|orcs]] in general) are best dealt with via crowd control strategies such as funneling them into hallways: a character that has not yet obtained [[poison resistance]] may have their game [[YASD|unceremoniously ended]] by a distantly shot poisoned arrow. This also makes [[Orcish Town]] especially perilous to break into, since the level and others within the [[Gnomish Mines]] will be full of Uruk-hai amd orc captains.

In theory, characters may want a supply of poisoned projectiles to use against monsters, which can offset their otherwise-lower damage compared to other arrows - in practice, only orcish Rangers and other orcish bow-users will be able to get the most out of them: a character will want poison resistance to best deal with the projectiles in the first place, and many roles with early poison resistance are not particularly bow-proficient.

Non-orcish bow users may still consider them as a substitute for their primary arrow stack, at least until they can find {{? of|enchant weapon}} scrolls and a [[luckstone]] or other [[luck item]] to minimize projectile mulching. Other characters can still pick up any orcish arrows left behind to prevent other monsters from becoming a threat with them until they gain poison resistance.

==History==
The orcish arrow is introduced in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[upgrading]] orcish arrows will produce standard arrows.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]], orcish arrows deal 1d5 damage to small monsters and 1d8 damage to large monsters, with a -1 [[to-hit]] penalty.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], [[goblin outrider]]s have the same chance of generating with an orcish bow and arrows as Uruk-hai. [[Watchmen]] and [[soldier]]s that are [[Racial monster|orcish]] have a {{frac|3}} chance of generating with orcish bows and arrows, and orcish [[sergeant]]s generated in stronghold areas may also generate with orcish arrows. [[Medusa]] is generated with an orcish bow and highly-enchanted orcish arrows that may be erodeproof.

The [[ice troll]]s stationed in each of the watch towers on the last level of the [[Ice Queen's Realm]] are each generated with an orcish bow and 100 orcish arrows, both uncursed. The structure containing the [[portal]] to the [[Wizard's Tower (EvilHack)|Wizard's Tower]] and the first floor of the branch are both guarded by a quartet of [[marilith]]s that each generate with an orcish bow and 100 orcish arrows, both uncursed. 

Orcish Rangers that [[invoke]] [[The Longbow of Diana]] will generate orcish arrows instead of standard ones.

Orcish arrows can be used at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] to create a couple of items:

* 2 orcish arrows can be combined with a [[knife]] to create an [[orcish dagger]].
* 2 orcish arrows can be combined with an orcish dagger to create an [[orcish spear]].

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], upgrading orcish arrows will produce standard arrows, and upgrading [[elven arrow]]s will produce orcish arrows.

In addition to EvilHack forge recipes, 2 [[dart]]s can be combined with 2 orcish arrows to create a knife.
